Unicron/Teufel/Vehement:




Unicron stepped back and watched as his creati=
on Teufel stepped out from the 
chamber, looking stronger than before.  Wel=
l, kind of.  He was thicker and 
was more armored.  Other than that he was =
the exact same.

"Lord Unicron, he does not looked that changed.  What did =
you do to him?"

"Er modernisiert mein defensiv m=F6glichkeiten und hologra=
phisch technologie." 
Teufel replied, still speaking the Earth language Ger=
man.

"What did he say, Lord Unicron?"

"Teufel explained what I did.  I up=
graded his defensive capabilities and 
holographic technology."

With that,=
 Teufel began to glow a bright blue and suddenly he seemed to 
shrink a few=
 feet and expand a little, taking the form of Zardus.  In another 
brief bl=
ue glow he was Megatron (BW), and then Soundwave (G1), and then 
Optimus Pr=
ime (G1).

"I can even sound like them." Teufel said, his voice a perfect m=
atch of 
Optimus Prime's and no longer in German.  

"His talents will be V=
ERY useful, Vehement.  Teufel, take the form of Zardus 
in case you encount=
er any of his insignificant beings." as soon as it was 
ordered, Teufel did=
 it.  "Vehement, you and Teufel will go to coordinates 
Kai-Centauri 28, 34=
.  You will have to search, but there is a Cybertronian's 
head there.  Ret=
rieve it, and bring it to me."

"Yes, my lord." Vehement said with a small =
bow, which wasn't easy.

"For the Chaos-Bringer." Teufel said, still lookin=
g and sounding like Zardus. 
 

The two beings left, heading for the coordi=
nates as Unicron smiled.  He 
stepped up to the Guardian computer and a gol=
den hue tendril wrapped around 
his head as he interfaced with the most adv=
anced computer on the planet and 
possibly the galaxy.
